title: *2023 Revolver Advent Coffee Calendar *PRE-ORDER, Arrives by December 1st*
body_html:
*This is a Pre-Order for the 5th Annual Revolver Coffee Advent Calendar. It will ship late November in order to arrive for the December 1st start date.

Please take a read over the product page or email us directly at sheriff@revolvercoffee.ca with any questions -- thank you!

It's that time of year again! For the 5th year in a row, we present to you the Revolver Coffee Advent Calendar, featuring 24 different coffees from 24 different roasters from around the globe.

Over the course of 24 days you'll experience a wide variety of flavour profiles and processing methods from coffees roasted here in Vancouver, throughout Canada and the USA, all the way overseas to Europe and beyond.

We build every calendar in house, pre-weighing the portions for each day, and each coffee is kept a surprise until the daily reveal online.

It's a great way to start your day with some light and warmth during the dark December mornings, and makes for a fantastic and unique gift for yourself or others that gives for 24 days.

What you get:

  • Each calendar contains 24 pre-portioned packs, each containing 20g. For most recipes (ours included) that will make 320g / 11oz of coffee.
  • Each coffee will be different, and from a different roaster around the globe.
  • The coffees are all unmarked, and revealed daily online.
  • Shipping is included in the price, anywhere in North America. (Outside North America there is an added shipping cost)

FAQ

  • Shipping, When and How Much $?
    This is a pre-order, and it will ship mid-late November to arrive in time for the December 1st start date. Advent ships Free anywhere in North America. Cost outside North America dependent on where it is.
  • Local Pick Up at Revolver Gastown
    If you choose to pick up at Revolver Gastown, the cost is the same but at the time of pick up we'll give you and a friend (or 2 for you?) any 2 drinks. When you checkout, you will have to choose 'shipping' and then you'll have an option for Pick Up at Revolver.

  • Which coffees / roasters can I expect inside?
    We don't have the list just yet, but below is last year's line up. If you drink coffee at Revolver, you'll like what's inside.

    3fe / Ireland
    April / Denmark
    Brandywine / Delaware
    Father's / Czech Republic
    Gardelli / Italy
    House of Funk / Vancouver
    Kudu / Greece
    Kurasu / Japan
    La Cabra / Denmark
    Loquat / Los Angeles
    Mame / Zurich
    Monogram / Calgary
    Night Swim / North Carolina
    Obadiah / Edinburgh
    Onyx / Arkansas
    Phil & Sebastian / Calgary
    Proud Mary / Portland
    Rogue Wave / Edmonton
    SEY / Brooklyn
    Sweet Bloom / Colorado
    Square Mile / London
    Traffic / Montreal
    Valor / Georgia
    The Barn / Berlin

  • Does the price include shipping?
    Yep!

  • What happens if I order additional coffee / equipment with my calendar?
    Any order containing an Advent calendar and another item will ship together mid / late November. If you want your item shipped ahead separately, please purchase it separately. We'll reach out directly if you have additional items to clarify / confirm what you'd like to do

  • Is this for Filter Coffee or Espresso?
    All coffee is roasted for filter / drip coffee, not espresso.

  • Is it the same cover as last year?
    No -- the cover will be different, but the package itself is the same as previous years. The one in the picture is from 2022.

  • Question not answered?
    Just throw us a line using the webshop chat funciton and we'll get back to you!

*This is a Pre-Order for the 5th Annual Revolver Coffee Advent Calendar. It will ship late November in order to arrive for the December 1st start date. Please note, if you purchase anything else in addition to the Advent Calendar, it will ship together (mid-late November). If you want the item shipped before then, please purchase separately -- we'll reach out directly to clarifiy any orders with multiple items.)

Any questions not answered here just throw us a line at sheriff@revolvercoffee.ca and we'll get back to you accordingly. Thanks!

title: Barn Brazil Ivan Dos Santos BULK 1KG *Natural Espresso*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Chocolate / Pecan Pie / Silky
Process: Natural
Varieties: Yellow Catuai
Roast Date: October 9
250g / 8.8oz

The Barn is located in Berlin, Germany

From The Barn

The dos Santos family has been growing coffee around Mount Caconde for over 40 years. The region is blessed with natural springs that sustain the beautiful area.

title: Barn Honduras Caballero Confite #3 *Natural Filter*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Banana / Red Grape / Rich
Process: Natural
Varieties: Catuai
Roast Date: October 9
250g / 8.8 oz

The Barn is located in Berlin, Germany

From The Barn

This is one of the most exciting summer coffees we have featured in a while. Expect a candied fruit punch: Eton Mess meets tropical fruit cocktail. Insanely exciting!

Located in the precious Marcala region of Honduras that Marysabel Caballero and Moises Herrera put on the coffee map by over 20 years of relentless work. Fast forward, and many Cup of Excellence wins later, they now produce coffee on more than 200 hectares, split into various farms to bring out different cup profiles.

Confite is a new cup category by Caballero: very sweet and almost candy-like. The name is given after a popular candy consisting of dried fruit, nuts or spices coated in sugar candy. Our coffee underwent an extended fermentation, helping to boost this candy quality.

This coffee stood out for its intense fruit flavours and candy-like sweetness: Notes of banana and pineapple are supported by red grapes, berries and dulce de leche. Almost like a desert (Eton Mess), the creamy mouthfeel makes you want to enjoy this coffee over and over again.

Marysabels father Don Fabio operates coffee farms around Marcala. After many years of poor profits, he decided to hand out land to his daughter Marysabel and her husband Moises Herrera. Moises brought his own farms into the family business and together they have almost 200 hectares of coffee split across various fincas.

Four years ago, Caballero began producing Naturals with dedication on improving the process (beans are dried with cherry). In Honduras drying Natural coffees can be challenging. The climate is very humid and it can rain during the drying period. This results in a drying period that can take from 20 up to 40 days, depending on temperatures.

Marysabel and Moises have played a big part in contributing to the growing reputation of Honduran coffees. Everything they do is documented, and considerable resources are invested both in new equipment and planting of new coffee varieties.

The Caballeros are committed to the environmental sustainability of their farms. A lot of their focus goes towards improving the soil of their farms to ensure a healthy environment. They produce organic fertilizer made from cow and chicken manure mixed with pulp from coffee cherries and other organic material. This is used in addition to some mineral fertilizer to ensure that the coffee plants get the nutrients they need. Oranges, avocados, flowers, bananas and other fruits are also grown at the farms, for the pickers to eat and to create biodiversity at the farms that ensures good growing conditions and shade for the coffee trees.

The Process

Moises began producing Naturals 3 or so years ago, initially only starting with 30 bags. Drying Natural coffees is very difficult in Honduras because of the humid climate and the rain experienced during the drying period. Moises has perfected the process over the years. They are picking ripe cherry and drying on covered raised beds. Initially the layer of cherry must be thin and as the coffee dries you can increase the thickness of the drying cherry. Cherry can take 20-40 days to dry depending on the temperatures

title: Belleville Chateau Belleville *Espresso / Filter*
body_html:
40% Neptaly Bautista, Honduras - 30% Kelem Wallaga, Ethiopia natural - 30% Tabe Burka, Ethiopia washed

Roaster's Tasting Notes: red wine / fruit / developed body
Roast Date: Oct 25
250g / 8oz

Cape Coffee is located in Paris, France

From Belleville

We discover a coffee that projects us into the world of red wine, with notes of matured fruit and a very developed body. Château Belleville offers unprecedented subtlety and stability. A blend that we are proud to present to you and which can be enjoyed as filter coffee or espresso in a stemmed glass or simply in your morning mug. With Château Belleville, we discover a coffee that projects us into the world of red wine, with notes of matured fruit and a very developed body. Château Belleville offers unprecedented subtlety and stability.

title: Belleville Hunapu Ciudad Veija Guatemala *Filter*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: apple / sweet caramel / reminiscent of toffee

Varieties: Bourbon
Roast Date: Oct 25
250g / 8oz

Belleville is located in Paris, France

From Belleville

Hunapu means “between the flowers” ​​in the Kiche language (the most widespread of the indigenous languages ​​in Guatemala) and also refers to the Agua volcano, one of the three volcanoes that surround the city of Antigua.

At the foot of this volcano (but still more than 1500m above sea level) is the large Bellavista farm, managed by the Zelaya family for 4 generations and within which a 350 hectare farm and a ski resort coexist. washing and drying station. Luis Pedro Zelaya and his family manage farms on behalf of owners and work, depending on the season, with 200 to 400 producers growing bourbon, caturra and catuai varieties on small plots around Antigua.

This year, Hunapu 2023 comes from the micro-region of Ciudad Vieja, whose volcanic lands offer very specific terroirs and contribute to obtaining this exceptional coffee.

Hunapu is a coffee with a beautiful roundness in the mouth, with notes of apple and sweet caramel reminiscent of toffee, that treat we loved as children.

body_html:

title: Cape Coffee Ethiopia Danche *Filter*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Cotton Candy / Peach / Meyer Lemon
Process: Washed
Varieties: Wolisho & Dega
Roast Date: Oct 10
250g / 8oz

Cape Coffee is located in Cape Broyle, Nova Scotia

From Cape Coffee

This is our first time buying coffee from Wilmer Galindez. He is an inspiring young man and an incredibly motivated producer who has overcome many challenges as a coffee grower. We look forward to con- tinuing working with Wilmer and other producers from the Monkaaba project. This washed blend of Pink Bourbon & Tabi has a vibrant acidity with flavours of milk chocolate, blood orange and sweetened iced tea.

title: House of Funk Faze Waves Papua New Guinea *Filter*
body_html:
Components: Papua New Guinea Simbu Province
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Maple / Baker's Chocolate / Peach
Process: Washed
Varietals: Typica
250g
Roast Date: September 6

House of Funk is located in North Vancouver, B.C.

From House of Funk

It's not every day that you see a Papua New Guinea in specialty coffee. This is our first time bringing in a coffee from PNG and we are stoked about it. This is rich, sweet and bright. It is quickly becoming our favorite morning coffee.

Aroma: Sweet brown sugar, honey and maple syrup aroma with rose jasmine and dark chocolate notes

Tasting: Exotic well balanced intense flavor with raspberry, strawberry, citrus/lemon and nectarine notes

Coffee was first introduced to Simbu in the early 1950's, it has been the most important crop to the local Simbuans. Each small holder farmer owns approx. 1 - 2 hectares of coffee 'garden' which they grow small amounts of coffee which they monitor carefully to create top grade coffee. PSC stands for Premium Smallholder Coffee, and this lot was graded as a A, or top lot.

title: House of Funk Monochrome *Espresso*
body_html:
Components: Guatemala Quetzaltenango
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Sweet Sweet Honeycomb / Milk Chocolate / Plums
Process: Washed
Varietals: Typica
250g
Roast Date: October 23

House of Funk is located in North Vancouver, B.C.

From House of Funk

As a pair to our Technicolour Espresso, this single origin espresso is bold, chocolatey and sweet. We thought it was time to bring you a Single Origin Espresso and what better choice than this Guatemala. We wanted something that had a subtle and subdue acidity and a strong bold chocolate flavours.
This is an espresso that is more sweet than bitter. Subtle fruit notes. Fantastic alone or in a Cappuccino.

title: House of Funk We Don't Have To Dance Kenya *Filter*
body_html:
Components: Kenya Murang's County Peaberry
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Yummy Soft Chocolate & Raspberry Cake
Process: Washed
Varietals: SL28 / SL34 / Ruiru 11
250g
Roast Date: October 24

House of Funk is located in North Vancouver, B.C.

From House of Funk

We told you we like Kenya’s coffees, but even we weren’t expecting this lovely little Peaberry to come along. So here we are with another Kenya for you!!
When we first tasted this coffee we were excited to bring it in. This coffee packs a lot of punch in their small little bean.

When you try this coffee you will notice the coffee has some subtle red wine notes while still having bright red raspberry fruit notes, light milk chocolate and a jammy body.

title: Intelligentsia House Blend *Instant Coffee*
body_html:
Intelligentsia House Blend Instant Coffee

5 Packs Per Box (Each Pack = 1 Cup)

Components: Brazil + Colombia + Rwanda
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Apple + Citrus + milk chocolate
Process: Honey + Washed

Just add 8oz of Hot or Cold Water and Voilá -- coffee wherever you are, instantly.

5 Packs.

From Intelligentsia:

Our House Blend is designed to showcase the intrinsic sweetness and lively fruit flavours that characterize our favourite coffees. Milk chocolate, citrus, and apple are tastes we love and are presented here with high definition clarity.

    Intelligentsia is located in Chicago, Illinois.

title: Intelligentsia Instant Black Cat *Instant Espresso/Coffee*
body_html:
Intelligentsia Black Cat Instant Espresso.

5 Packs Per Box (Each Pack = 1 Cup)

Components: Brazil + Colombia
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Dark Chocolate, Raw Sugar, Marshmallow
Process: Honey + Washed
Roast Date:
5 Packs.

From Intelligentsia:

Introducing our new Instant Espresso Black Cat Classic! A new freeze-dried instant coffee with notes of dark chocolate, raw sugar and marshmallow based on our best-selling signature espresso blend. Simply pour the instant espresso into your cup, add hot or cold water or milk of your choice, stir & enjoy. Great while traveling, on-the-go, or to enjoy that great espresso taste without the fancy equipment. You can even use it to make a macchiato, cappuccino, americano, or latte at home! Each box contains five individual servings.

THE DETAILS

  • Espresso: 1-2 fl oz hot or cold water
  • Macchiato: 1-2 fl oz hot or cold milk
  • Cappuccino: 5-6 fl oz hot or cold milk
  • Americano: 8-10 fl oz hot or cold water
  • Latte: 8-10 fl oz hot or cold milk

Intelligentsia is located in Chicago, Illinois.

title: Luna Ethiopia Zelelu Ararso*Filter*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Sebuckthorn / Coconut / Sencha
Process: Washed
Varieties: 74110 / 74112
Roast Date: October 25
250g / 8.8oz

Luna is located in Vancouver, B.C.

From Luna

Complex and sweet with seabuckthorn berry, coconut and soft sencha, this delicate delight of a coffee comes from a single producer (Zelelu Ararso) in Yirgacheffe, Ethiopia.

This lot consists of 74110 & 74112 varieties picked and processed in the style of a traditional washed process, as part of a collaborative effort with YCFCU to highlight smallholder producers who grow exceptional coffees.

title: Luna Hazelnut Cookie *Filter*
body_html:
Components: Guatemala Perez El Llano
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Jam Thumbprint Cookie / Hazelnut Frangipane
Process: Washed
Varieties: H1 Hybrid
Roast Date: October 25
250g / 8.8oz

Luna is located in Vancouver, B.C.

From Luna

Sweet and clean like hazelnut frangipane and soft jam cookies, this unique variety is grown by the Pérez family on their farm El Llano in Acatenango, Guatemala.

This is an F1 hybrid called H1 (also known as Centroamericano) that was developed by crossing a selection of Sarchimor with the Ethiopian landrace variety Rume Sudan

title: Luna Violet Sunshine Ethiopia Duromina *Espresso*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Violet Florals / Riesling Grape / Buttery Texture
Process: Washed
Varieties: local landrace
Roast Date: October 23
250g / 8.8oz

Luna is located in Vancouver, B.C.

From Luna

Duromina is back! We cupped more lots from Duromina when locking in our buys for Nano Genji and thought this lot from Duromina would make beautiful espresso.

With gentle violet florals, juicy riesling grape acidity, and buttery texture to round it all out, this washed processed lot from Duromina cooperative consists of local landrace varieties picked and processed with soil, water, and biodiversity in mind, coffees coming from the forests in Agaro represents some of the few semi-wild coffees remaining in the ancestral lands of Ethiopia.

body_html:

Process: Washed

250g / 8.8oz

Luna is located in Vancouver, B.C.

From Luna

Duromina is back! We cupped more lots from Duromina when locking in our buys for Nano Genji and thought this lot from Duromina would make beautiful espresso.

With gentle violet florals, juicy riesling grape acidity, and buttery texture to round it all out, this washed processed lot from Duromina cooperative consists of local landrace varieties picked and processed with soil, water, and biodiversity in mind, coffees coming from the forests in Agaro represents some of the few semi-wild coffees remaining in the ancestral lands of Ethiopia.

title: Monogram Colombia San Vicente *Espresso*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Orange / Plum / Cane Sugar
Process: Washed
Varietals: Castillo / Caturra / Colombia
340g / 12oz
Roast Date: October 1

Monogram is located in Calgary, Alberta.

From Monogram

This coffee is produced by many small holder farmers who are members of the OCCICAFE cooperative from San Vicente, which is located just 10 km away from La Plata, Huila, sitting between 1500 - 1950 MASL. The members of this cooperative have been working together to improve the quality of their coffee since 2015, and for the last 4 years they have been under the guidance of the Cofinet to make further improvements, including some new processing methods. This regional blend is super approachable with classic flavours of chocolate and brown sugar with some juicy orange citrus notes.

title: Phil & Sebastian Ethiopia Addisu Kidane Lot #2
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: PEACH, VANILLA WAFER, BLACK TEA
Process: Washed by Fermentation
Varieties: Wolisho & Dega
Roast Date: Oct 23
300g / 10.85oz

Phil & Sebastian is located in Calgary, Alberta

From Phil & Sebastian

In addition to having a cool-sounding name, Addisu Kidane has taken Ethiopian coffee by storm. He only built his wet mill in 2022, and already he's producing some of the top coffee in Gedeb, a region already known for some of the best coffee in all of Ethiopia.

title: Phil & Sebastian Ethiopia Siko Village Screen #14 *Espresso*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes:PEACH NECTAR, BLACK TEA, ROSE
Process: Washed
Varieties: Kurume & Dega
Roast Date: oct 19
300g / 10.5oz

Phil & Sebastian is located in Calgary, Alberta

From Phil & Sebastian

Uraga is pretty much a straight shot east of Gedeb, so I’m able to pair visits to both of my favorite regions on the same trip! The area is on my hit-list every time I make it into the countryside of Ethiopia (Pre-Covid, I traveled to Ethiopia yearly, but sometimes I couldn’t go into the countryside for safety reasons).

I was delighted to return to Ethiopia in January 2023 after three years away. It was perhaps my most memorable trip, as I had missed all of my friends and colleagues. I was also greatly concerned about their well-being.

Ethiopia faced Covid, like everyone else, but on top of that, there was a civil war in the north of the country. It was truly awe-inspiring to see how everyone I ran into in Ethiopia had handled both, adapting to these challenges and focusing on progressing quality and building their businesses. The reality is that volatility is the baseline of normal in Ethiopia, and perhaps this equips them better than the rest of us to handle it!

This green coffee was frozen immediately upon arrival.

-Phil

title: Prodigal Colombia Finca Betel Gyrola *Sudan Rume Natural Filter*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Tropical Fruits / Strawberry / Citrus
Process: Sudan Rume Natural
Varieties: Sunda Rume
Roast Date: October 1
150g

Prodigal is located in Colorado

From Prodigal

Finca Betel has produced yet another beautiful coffee for us. Prodigal is thrilled to have this exclusive lot César Ledesma calls "gyrola", named for the local tanager bird. The flavors of guava, strawberry, and citrus are bold and striking.

This lot fermented anaerobically for 72 hours before solar drying for 36 hours. Then the coffee underwent mechanical drying until ideal moisture content was reached. Interestingly, this coffee requires 20% more cherry than other varieties to produce the same amount of green coffee. This Sudan Rume variety seed stock came from Diego Bermudez's farm Finca Paraiso in 2017. Now 500 of these trees flourish at Finca Betel.

title: Proud Mary Panama Finca Momoto Afrocina *Natural Filter*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Purple Grape / Watermelon / Floral
Process: Natural
Varieties: Afrocina
Roast Date: October 4
100g

Proud Mary is located in Portland, Oregon

From Proud Mary

Founded in 2015 by Aliss Hartmann, Finca Momoto is a new branch on the storied Hartmann family tree. Aliss and her four siblings grew up at Finca Hartmann, playing amongst the coffee trees and climbing on bags of stored parchment at the mill. As adults, the Hartmann children each took roles at Finca Hartmann – Aliss managing the administrative side of the business. As her own children, Giuliana and Giuseppe grew up, she wanted them to have a similar childhood to herself. She purchased Finca Momoto to teach them the value of the land, respect for nature, and to share with them the same love and passion for coffee that her parents shared with her. Aliss applies an environmentally sustainable approach to coffee production, with most of the coffee from Finca Momoto processed using the natural method, eliminating the need for significant water usage. This lot is a rare heirloom variety brought to Panama many years ago from the coffee forests of Ethiopia. It has thrived in its new home, producing a complex and interesting cup with notes of watermelon and grape.

title: Resident Colombia El Dulce / WB
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Panela / Creme Brulee / Sweet Citrus
Process: Washed
Varieties: Caturra / Castillo / Colombia
Roast Date: October 9
250g / 8.8oz

Resident is located in Gainesville, Florida

From Resident

Back to Colombia with El Dulce from Finca La Ermita. Round two with this gem, and it's like catching up with an old friend. Nestled in Arboleda, Narino, this coffee brings hints of Panela and Crème Brûlée, with a citrusy backdrop. Consistency in relationships matters — with our producers, importers, and you. Excited for you to revisit this one with us.

title: Resident Ethiopia Hada Molecha *Natural Filter*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Mango / Florida Wildflower Honey / Jasmine Tea
Process: Washed
Varieties: 74118 / 74110 / 74165 / 74112 / Kurume / Dega / Wolisho
Roast Date: October 9
250g / 8.8oz

Resident is located in Gainesville, Florida

From Resident

We've found something special in this Ethiopian coffee. Its delicate flavors of mango and Florida wildflower honey, paired with a body reminiscent of complex jasmine tea, really stand out. I couldn’t stay away from this coffee on the cupping table.

The journey of this coffee starts high in the Yirgacheffe region, with the farmers of the Gedeo people. Their land, perched between 1950 - 2150 meters above sea level, is home to the coffee trees that produce these varieties. They depend on their coffee crops for their livelihood - to send their kids to school, to clothe their families.

In the Gedeo zone, 68% of all cultivated land is planted to coffee. Coffee plants grow under the shade of enset plants, while goats and cattle roam free. Houses, made of wood or bamboo, are scattered across the landscape, their roofs a colorful patchwork of natural fibers and painted tin tiles. This is a place where community matters, and every cup of Hada Molecha tells a part of their story.

title: Resident Kenya Kamviu AA / Filter
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Juicy Passionfruit / Sauv Blanc / Blood Orange
Process: Washed
Varieties: SL28 / SL34
Roast Date: October 9
250g / 8.8oz

Resident is located in Gainesville, Florida

From Resident

A kaleidoscope of fresh mango aroma, a sparkling body like a sauvignon blanc, and a sweet splash of citrus akin to a ripe blood orange. A juicy delight, it's the embodiment of Kenyan coffee at its finest. Whether you're brewing it as an espresso or a filter coffee, it unfolds different notes - from highlighting its deep citrusy sugars to its delicate floral undertones.

This coffee's journey starts in Kamviu, home to the Gakundu Farmers’ Cooperative Society. Here, against all odds, around a thousand resilient farmers cultivate SL 28 and SL 34 coffee varieties in red volcanic soil, high up at elevations of 1600-1700 meters. Despite the region's cool temperatures posing threats of coffee berry disease and frost, these farmers persist, earning Embu County its accolades for producing some of Kenya's most vibrant coffees.

title: Thom Bargen "Always Sunny" *Espresso + Filter*
body_html:
Components: Colombia Huila
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Chocolate / Nutty / Full Body
Process: Washed
Varieties: Colombia / Typica / Castillo
Roast Date: oct 23
300g

Thom Bargen is located in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

From Thom Bargen

High up in the clouds around 1900 meters above sea level, near the town of San Agustin, sits Los Naranjos. 14 years ago Henry and Tanya set out to purchase a farm and seek a better life for themselves. After winning a local raffle, Henry took his winnings (two cows) and sold them to the bank to get credit for his new farm. Years later, they are proud farmers with a beautiful house and lovely family. Something that sets them apart is that they are a hands-on family farm. They pick the coffee with cousins, process on their own wet-mill and transport the coffee. It's a true family operation. It is in part due to this attention to detail that they produce some of the best Caturra and bourbon in the area. Their story is one of hope for the area. It's a great example of how hard work, improved quality, and selling into the specialty coffee industry can drastically improve a farmer's income and overall lifestyle. We are very proud to have Don Henry & Tanya's coffee contribute to our ALWAYS SUNNY coffee annually.

title: Thom Bargen "Always Sunny" BULK 2LBS *Espresso*
body_html:
Components: Colombia Huila
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Chocolate / Nutty / Full Body
Process: Washed
Varieties:Colombia / Typica / Castillo
Roast Date: Oct 23
908g / 2LBS

From Thom Bargen

High up in the clouds around 1900 meters above sea level, near the town of San Agustin, sits Los Naranjos. 14 years ago Henry and Tanya set out to purchase a farm and seek a better life for themselves. After winning a local raffle, Henry took his winnings (two cows) and sold them to the bank to get credit for his new farm. Years later, they are proud farmers with a beautiful house and lovely family. Something that sets them apart is that they are a hands-on family farm. They pick the coffee with cousins, process on their own wet-mill and transport the coffee. It's a true family operation. It is in part due to this attention to detail that they produce some of the best Caturra and bourbon in the area. Their story is one of hope for the area. It's a great example of how hard work, improved quality, and selling into the specialty coffee industry can drastically improve a farmer's income and overall lifestyle. We are very proud to have Don Henry & Tanya's coffee contribute to our ALWAYS SUNNY coffee annually.

Thom Bargen is located in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

title: Thom Bargen Always Sleepy *Decaf*
body_html:
Components: Colombia Huila Los Idolos
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Sweet Brown Sugar / Honey / Milk Chocolate
Process: Washed, E.A. Natural Decaf
Varieties: Colombia / Typica / Castillo
Roast Date: October 23
300g

Thom Bargen is located in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

From Thom Bargen:

Currently our DECAF coffee is from Los Idolos COLOMBIA.

It is a E.A. natural decaf. The beans are rinsed with Ethyl Acetate, a natural compound, non-GMO Colombian sugarcane and mountain water. Fully removing 97% of the caffeine.

title: Thom Bargen Ethiopia Dumerso Sisters *Filter*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Floral / Honey / Black Tea / Peach
Process: Washed
Varieties: Heirloom
Roast Date: October 23
300g / 10oz

Thom Bargen is located in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

From Thom Bargen:

We had the opportunity to visit Ethiopia this year. When we first tasted the Dumerso Sisters coffee in Addis, we were blown away! The coffee was delicate, clean, and floral. This is exactly what we look for in Guji and Yirgacheffe coffees. We then travelled up country to visit them in Hirut. We walked their washing station and learned about their social initiatives. Their passion for coffee and community is impressive. For more info on this, check out our farm stories.

title: Thom Bargen Kenya Gatina AA *Filter*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Black Currant / Green Apple / Cinnamon / Jolly Rancher / Toffee
Process: Washed
Varieties: Batian / Ruiru 11 / SL28 / SL34
Roast Date: Oct 23
300g / 10oz

Thom Bargen is located in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

From Thom Bargen:

Gatina Washing Station sits a few kilometers outside the town of Karatina in Nyeri County. The station was built in 1968, nestled between the western slopes of Mt. Kenya and the eastern slopes of the Aberdares mountains. It is managed by Mugaga Farmers’ Cooperative Society. Today, the station receives cherry from 790 members. Of those, 280—over 30%—are women!

The 790 members of Gatina station cultivate a total of 142 hectares. This breaks down to about a tenth of a hectare—or a few hundred trees—per farmer. Such small coffee ‘gardens’ makes it possible, vital even, to focus on specialty processing and increase the value per kilogram of cherry picked. Farm labor is usually entirely provided by family members, which can often make maintaining specialty cultivation and picking practices easier. Many of the farmers also grow tea, maize and legumes to consume or sell at local markets for additional cash income.

title: Traffic Brazil Marcello Flavio *Natural Filter*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Chocolate Milkshake / Peanut Butter Cookie / Keylime Pie
Process: Natural
Varieties: Paraiso
Roast Date: October 24
300g

Traffic is located in Montreal, Quebec

From Traffic

This marks the 4th year we buy the most exceptional coffee offered by Marcelo. Marcelo & Flavio's commitment to quality & excellence is why, for years to come, we will be working with them & Bioma/Aequitas, on these farms. This year, this natural is so clean, you'd think it was a washed coffee. Sweet, rich, very heavy body that pairs beautifully with milk, & as an espresso, finishes with a very subtle lime/tropical note. VERY low acidity coffee for those who aren't fond of bright cups ; )

Bioma Café’s story begins back in 2001 when Marcelo Nogueira Assis and Flavio Marcio Silva met each other and committed their life purposes in farming. Both, Marcelo and Flavio, were born in families that carry the agriculture DNA. Flavio who has vast experience in managing the family businesses met Marcelo who was a recent graduate in the technical school of agriculture and cattle and was eager to explore the farming universe. As a result, they formed a partnership based on love for agriculture, respect, and reciprocity.

Coffee is a passion for most people that live in Cerrado, in the state of Minas Gerais and it wasn't different for the young entrepreneurs who were born and raised among coffee plantations. In 2010, an opportunity arose and they constituted the first farm, focused on specialty coffee production in Campos Altos region, Minas Gerais. They carefully evaluated each piece of land that would receive the coffee crops, after all the purpose was of producing extraordinary coffees. After a long period looking for the perfect terroir, the farm location was selected, a place that produces the most incredible coffees in the high plateaus of Cerrado Mineiro. The Cerrado is one of the richest biomes in the world in terms of biodiversity, and Bioma Café emerged with the purpose of producing specialty coffees maintaining the balance between agriculture and the Cerrado biome.

title: Traffic Juice Bomb #6 Kenya Kimabu *Filter*
body_html:
Components: Kenya Kiambu Ibonia Estae
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Pink Grapefruit / Apricot / Earl Grey
Process: Washed
Varieties: Ruiru 11 / SL28 / SL32
Roast Date: October 24
300g

Traffic is located in Montreal, Quebec

From Traffic

Back again by popular demand & frankly, incessant emails/DMs/phonecalls regarding the status of the "next" Juicebomb. LoL.

This little thing we did years ago to call a coffee "Juicebomb"...our big Kenyan purchase of the year...seems to have really taken off because of all of you. So Thanks for that!

It really came about in the most mundane way, really. We'd cup tables of coffee's & say "oh man, that coffee's such a juicebomb" or something to that effect. I was a no brainer to design a bag around that and source some juicy coffees to throw in there. Kenya has always had these coffees that, if roasted right, always felt so deeply sweet & juicy, to the point that your pallet is whetted in just the right way & it keeps you coming back for more. Did this just get NSFW?!

HA! Nah, but for real, we love this Ibonia estate lot...there's a bunch so Hopefully it's around for a while. Here's to another year of JB & here's to y'all for making this a thing. LOVE.

KENYA

Working with the same Co-Op/Factory/Estate & having consistent quality is tough. Each year we have to hope to get something that we ultimately love, from a source we have worked with before & something we know everyone can enjoy. Kenyan coffees are some of the most expensive, that's reflective in the pricing as you're probably all aware of if you're fans. In all honesty, every year we definitely have a cap on what we can spend at origin, but we make sure to make less on our Kenyan just so we can offer it as accessibly as possible. It's the real deal. That's our reality with Kenya right now but we have plans for the future to shake up the system & get closer to the people that make these incredible complex cups of coffee possible.

Located only three miles from Kiambu Town, Ibonia Estate spans nearly 200 hectares - 60% of which is natural forest, wetlands, rivers and wildlife. The rest is dedicated to coffee, which is worked by around 200 workers during the harvest.
The soil is rich and red Kikuyu loam, the genetics are dominated by SL28s, and the management practices are top-notch.

Kenya is an enigma. It occupies a top spot in specialty – Kenyan top lots are always amongst the most expensive of any harvest. But yet it’s a country where coffee production is dropping year over year. Kenya is a place where traceability is given, but knowing what you want and how to get it are two different things. Rarely do we find partners more capable, and loyalties more difficult to navigate than we do in Kenya. For all the aforementioned reasons, competition in Kenya is fierce, making prized coffees feel like even more of a success.

However, no matter how formally the industry is structured, coffee still remains a system of people. And in a country where farmers own their own cherry production, there is additional power to connecting with coffee’s most important stakeholder. Farmers can, for example, point you to the best collections from every harvest, or delay sending their lots to auction to give you another week to sample. At request they can change the way they separate lots, bringing new products to market in a year that would take other countries nearly a decade to do.
But experimentation is not the name of the game. With washed coffees working so well, you won’t find many a manager willing to mess around with different fermentations, flotation, drying times or with certifications like organic.
The experiment instead is that of business model. How do cooperatives normalize earnings to keep their members engaged in coffee? How do we take away red tape to encourage more farmers to plant more coffee, as opposed to corn or dairy? How can small estates split off and succeed under their own pulping license? Is it better to sell through auction or directly to an international buyer – can you afford to cut out your marketing agent? Once you speak to these problems you are speaking the language of coffee in Kenya – this is a country that already knows how to "coffee".

title: Traffic Kenya Ndiara *Filter*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Pineapple / Rhubarb / Boysenberry
Process: Washed
Varieties: SL28 / SL34 / Ruiru 11 / Batian
Roast Date: October 24

300g

Traffic is located in Montreal, Quebec

From Traffic

An incredible way to kick off Kenyan season. This sparkling, vibrant coffee is so friggin' delicious, we've been drinking our stash for the past few weeks as we've ramped up for this release. Please enjoy this first offering, it may even be the best Kenyan of the year. Although we planned this release earlier in the year, the coffee shining the way it does was almost unexpected. Hope y'all think so too.

The Ndiara washing station serves around 400 active members from Ndiara village itself, as well as the the neighboring villages of Kagumoini, Kagioni, Mathioya, Kiogini and Kiriani. A member of the larger Kiru Farmers Cooperative Society, the Ndiara washing station started operations in 1999, making steady improvements to infrastructure - namely pulpers, drying beds and water purification – with the rest of the premiums they earn through quality going back to members.

Kenya is an enigma. It occupies a top spot in specialty – Kenyan top lots are always amongst the most expensive of any harvest. Yet it’s a country where coffee production is dropping year over year. Kenya is a place where traceability is given, but knowing what you want and how to get it are two different things. Rarely do we find partners more capable, and loyalties more difficult to navigate than we do in Kenya. For all the aforementioned reasons, competition in Kenya is fierce,making prized coffees feel like even more of a success.

title: Traffic Milkshake *Washed + Natural Espresso*
body_html:
Components: Kenya Kiambu + Ethiopia Sidama
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Upside Down Pineapple Cake / Peach / Raspberry
Process: Wahead + Natrial
Roast Date: October 24
300g

Traffic is located in Montreal, Quebec

From Traffic

This is a little something we threw together for those that crave a very fruit forward coffee aimed at espresso extractions. Although this is a super limited run, it may come back into the menu over the course of the year. For now, it's here. Hit it early & often for daily maximum milkshake motivation.

Made with coffees we'd serve as Single Origins, as usual, this blend is of the utmost quality. It's something we do differently here at Traffic. Blends are only made with coffees that score high on their own, no "blender" items here.

We recommend larger shots, so, a larger ratio of dry to wet.

EXAMPLE: 17g ground coffee = 42.5-45g of espresso (in 29-31 seconds)

(This is a 1:2.5-2.75 ratio)

title: Traffic Olympus *Washed + Natural Espresso*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Milk Chocolate / Dulce De Leche / Almond
Process: Washed + Natural
Roast Date: October 10
300g

Traffic is located in Montreal, Quebec

From Traffic

The “Olympus” is that constant workhorse, ready to perform everyday. It's an oldschool vibe of big creamy peanut butter, chocolate, & toffee with a small bit of candied orange that accents the syrupy sweet notes. Cuts through milk like gangbusters so you're never drinking...well, just a cup of warm milk : /

This blend is seasonal, as are all of our blends but we try to always keep the origins the same. Fresh Brazil from our favourite microlot projects and some super sweet central & south american coffees that have won our cupping tables each quarter. Is this coffee super funky? NO. It's not supposed to be.

It's about the early 2000's at the beginning of specialty coffee in Montreal. It's your favourite pair of skate shoes. Your favourite Montreal Haunt. Your best friends.

This coffee is about the tried and true & the "always there for you".

Cheers!

title: Traffic Sumatra Pantan Musara *Intense Anaerobic Filter*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Plum Wine / Cactus / Lychee / Magnolia / Spearmint / Peach Rings
Process: Intense Anaerobic
Varieties: Ateng Super
Roast Date: September 26
200g

Traffic is located in Montreal, Quebec

From Traffic

WOWOWEEWAAAA! VERY NICE!

This coffee is so funky with tons of beautiful florals & fruit notes splashed onto this canvas that is Pantan Musara. Like a Riopelle painting, it's chaotic & full of colors and textures, taking you on a journey that lingers in the finish & keeps you coming back for more. This is one of the best coffees we've had all year & from one of the very best producers in all of Indonesia. It's not cheap, but it's 100% worth your hard earned dollars if unique, exquisite coffees are your thing.

As always, treat yourself, don't cheat yourself.

The son of a coffee producer in Aceh, Hendra Maulizar started aprocessing station in 2010, growing it from just one acreto 10 hectares. Beginning in 2014, he shifted his focus to specialty coffee production, investing in post-harvest processing
experimentation and facilities—such as a wet mill, gravitation washing channels, and raised drying beds. His innovationand pursuit of quality has led to Hendra winning #7 in the Cup of Excellence Indonesia competition in 2021 and #16 in
2022. At his processing station in Aceh-Pantan Musara Village, Hendra purchases cherry from 50 farmers surrounding his wet mill.

Led by Hendra Maulizar, the Gegaring Team produces some of the highest quality, most sought after micro lots in all of Indonesia. They are processing these coffees in the mountains of central Aceh in North Sumatra. Winning 16th & 7th in back to back Cup of Excellence showings.
Hendra works with three farms in Aceh Gayo. He makes himself available to watch over the entire process from start to finish while relying on a team of incredible producers who work together to see each other succeed. Most of their coffees fly under the banner name of Pegasing, where the coffees are farmed and collected into central facilities. Fusing innovations in fermentation and drying with Sumatra's unique varieties, Hendra has made his team of producers and his methods the premier pioneering act in Sumatra specialty coffee processes.

To talk about Sumatra we need to speak of its size. It’s large. Larger than Texas and Florida combined. In the middle of the island is a caldera called Lake Toba: the largest caldera from the largest volcanic explosion this world has ever seen.
In this lake there is an island bigger than the country of Singapore. It is because of this lake that Sumatra has the largest rainfall seen by any coffee exporting country – the lake feeds clouds trapped in by the island’s 1500m tall mountains. Sumatra is old. When Marco Polo visited the island’s northern tip back in 1292, he found the local people speaking Sanskrit, one of the purest remaining forms of the ancient language. When the Dutch East Indian Trading Company came, Aceh (and later Java) became the first commercial coffee origins that the world had seen.Sumatra is big; I know we already said that, but it is really, really big. There are over 52 languages over four major ethnic groups (Acehnese, Minangkabaunese, Batak and Mala) covering an area over 170,500 square miles around. However big the island, however, there is only one government-authorized port of export – the 15 million person city of Medan. To get here, coffee has to travel as far as 375 miles, over massive mountains and on roads that are mostly still mud. That’s 20 hours north to the producing regions Gayo Aceh, or 24 hours to the southern most Arabica regions in Kerinci. And this is the main reason that Sumatran coffee is hulled while wet, and dried while in the green. Called Giling Basah, this process starts with coffee parchment being dried to 30-50% moisture before being milled into green beans. Higher moisture during transport from the farm to the port can lend to the classic ‘earthy, musty’ flavors that you get in some Sumatrans. Another source of Sumatra’s unique flavors dates back to the turn of the 20th century when Indonesia’s coffee crop was wiped out by leaf rust. Much of this was replaced with HDT (Hybrid de Timor) (Bourbon x Robusta), its direct descendant Tim Tim, or the more modern Sigarar Utang (Tim Tim x Bourbon).
And these are Robusta-Arabica hybrids; over the generations these have only added more Arabica through crossing Tim-Tim and with Sigarar Utang (Ateng). But there are pure Arabica strains as well, like Jember (Bourbon x Typica), USDA (Ethiopian Arabica transplant), and Onan Ganjan (Jember x Bourbon). So the genetic stock is absolutely unique. But what makes Sumatra truly unique are Sumatrans. As a new generation takes the reigns, they are taking the country headlong into specialty. The past years have seen an explosion of washed coffees, naturals, honeys, new varietals, new regions and new ways of thinking about Sumatra’s role in specialty coffee. Not just locally, but regionally –Indonesian coffee has so much to offer, and so much of what comes out of Bali, Flores, Timor and Sulawesi comes through Sumatra.

title: Traffic Tripping Daisies *Natural + Yellow Honey Espresso*
body_html:
Components: Brazil Marcelo Assis + Ethiopia Shantawene
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Chocolate Cake / Wild Berry Preserves / Almond
Process: Natural (both)
Varieties: Heirlooms / Bourbon
Roast Date: October 10
300g
Traffic is located in Montreal, Quebec.

From Traffic

This will be available for a very limited time. We're trying to nail down a source for Natural Ethiopian that can work in this blend. The prices of coffee are wayyyy up, & will continue to rise due to the pandemic & mother nature which has cut crop yields. Just today, the 19th of September 2022, as we write this we have heard that Brazil is down almost 40% which is very dire news for coffee prices.

Please enjoy this while it lasts & remember that we're lucky to have amazing coffees, for now. Take none of it for granted.

Wake up. Smell the flowers, & have a fruit laced spro with just a touch of funk.

We know we made everyone wait quite a while before releasing an adventurous espresso. The thing is, we all need staples. That's why Olympus & Dante came first. Then, came something a little more wild. Tripping Daisies is a much more fruit forward espresso. That doesn't mean it doesn't have body! It's rich like chocolate cake, it has some funky jammy fruits in there...it's delicious.

Bao-chika-waowaow ; )

Alright, we were just trying it out. We won't do that again.

title: Valor Hayride *Fall Blend Filter*
body_html:
Roaster's Tasting Notes: Rich S'mores / Black Currant / Spooky Stories
Process: Washed
Varieties: Caturra / Catuai / Ruiru 11 / SL28 / Batian
Roast Date: October 2
283g / 10oz

Valor is located in Alpharetta, Georgia.

From Valor

Every season we release a special coffee that matches the mood of the time of the year. Say "hey" to Hayride! Our fall blend feels like a warm hug in a cool breeze with notes of dark chocolate s'mores and pleasantly tart black currant.
